Summer Immersive 2014

Classes Instructors Students Schedule

Classes / Week 3: JavaScript

Taught by Shawn Allen

Course Description

This course will provide you with a solid understanding of the JavaScript programming language and its use in the context of web browsers. We'll learn language fundamentals and use them in creative applications.

Software Used

  • Atom
  • GitHub
  • Google Chrome

Resources Referenced

  • Code Academy offers a great introduction to the language
  • Eloquent JavaScript is a more in-depth web book
  • JavaScript: The Definitive Guide is the JavaScript book you want on your bookshelf
  • Live-coding tools:
    • JSFiddle
    • JS Bin
    • CodePen
    • jsconsole.com

Tuesday, July 1st (6pm - 9pm)

On our first day we covered the basics of JavaScript syntax. The slides are in the slides directory, which you can view locally by cloning this repository. Here's the outline:

  • JavaScript basics:
    • Variables, the var statement) and data types
    • Expressions and operators, equality and boolean expressions
    • Control structures: if...else, for, for..in, while, switch, et al
    • Objects and literals
    • Global objects and literals
    • Functions
  • Running code in the Chrome Dev Tools console
  • Adding scripts to your HTML
  • The Document Object Model (DOM)
    • Modifying, adding and removing HTML and CSS
    • querySelector() and querySelectorAll()
    • Events and listeners with addEventListener()
  • Helper libraries:
    • jQuery
    • D3
  • An example JavaScript-driven grocery list:
    • using jQuery
    • using D3
    • with D3 data binding
  • SVG circles with D3

Thursday, July 3rd (6pm - 9pm)

Tonight we went deeper into JavaScript:

  • Object-oriented vs. Functional programming
  • Object and Array data structures
  • Prototypal inheritance with Object.prototype
  • this and function calling context via call() and apply()

Then we dove into two very different graphics APIs:

  1. Drawing pixels with Canvas:
    • The Canvas 2D Context API
    • Check out this Canvas cheat sheet or this one in PDF or PNG
    • This guide is comprehensive, but dense
  2. Drawing vectors with SVG:
    • SVG elements and attributes
    • Tools:
    • D3
    • RaphaÃ«l
    • Paper.js
  3. Playtime:
    • a rudimentary Canvas drawing app
    • a version that snaps to a grid
    • a simliar drawing app in D3
    • a more psychedelic version

Here are the slides, but you'll probably have more luck running them locally.

Saturday, July 5th (12pm - 6pm)

On Saturday we covered the basics of loading external files, the JSON standard, and hacked on some animated sketches and SVG.

  • Asynchronous programming:
    • Loading external files:
    • with XMLHttpRequest
    • with jQuery.ajax()
    • with d3.xhr() and related functions
  • The JSON format
    • Parsing with JSON.parse()
    • Serializing with JSON.stringify()
  • Cross-Origin Resource Sharing
    • Testing locally with python -m SimpleHTTPServer (see: the Python module)
  • Repetition with setInterval()
    • See also: requestAnimationFrame()
  • See the examples directory for the sketches.

Brought to you by Gray Area Art & Technology in 2014.
